snippet: The Food and Drug Administration is considering the residual drowsiness that can persist the day after taking prescription sleep aids, and whether users can drive safely upon waking.
abstract: Food and Drug Administration is considering residual drowsiness that can persist well into next day after taking prescription sleep aids, and whether users can drive safely upon waking; FDA's actions are part of a robust national conversation about how to cope with throngs of drivers who take to roads every day under the influence of prescription drugs.
lead_paragraph: The Food and Drug Administration is considering the residual drowsiness that can persist the day after taking prescription sleep aids, and whether users can drive safely upon waking.

headline.main: To Judge Sleep Aids, U.S. Looks at Drowsy Driving in the Morning
